text: Either make it so all tailwind classes apply !important in the config or maybe using an additional composite class could work. Its a bit akward when you try to use tailwind on top of an existing theme

Set a prefix in your Tailwind config.
<https://tailwindcss.com/docs/configuration#prefix>
I don't think this is his issue, its probobly just that theme css is overding the tailwind one since the composite classes have a deeper selection
Might be, I had an issue that _some_ normal/theme styles would be overriden by Tailwind, on pages that included a React module (with TW). Using a prefix and disabling preflight helped.

I'm getting this error while deploying the react project,
```[ERROR] The post in account 1432xxxxx was bad. Platform version is missing from your project configuration. Please add the platformVersion field to the hsproject.json file, then try uploading the project again. Available versions: [2023.2].```
and I already have project version in my `hsproject.json` file.
```{
  "name": "trust-project",
  "srcDir": ".",
  "platformVersion": "2023.2"
}```
How I can get rid of this error? <@UCY83QS6Q> <@UAYBXDG4U>
last time I ran into this error it was because my HubSpot CLI needed to be updated. Either in the project itself or in the outer package.json of the root folder
I'm going to use dangerouslySetInnerHTML for now but it would be great if this kind of thing was supported

I did disable preflight and it helped since the tailwind styles didn't clash with my site however the existing theme clashed with my component, Anze is right, might just have to go with 'important!' for now, thanks guys!
I'm curious about how the composite class approach would look like
Id wrap everything in a class using Saas to process it and then just apply that class to your module or use a wrapper component
hi guys how do i make sure the img srcSet works? im expecting it to load a smaller sized img (400x225 in this case) on smaller screens but it still loads 800x450
